content.question: Carts <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> are on identical horizontal tracks. During a <math alttext="3 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> interval, the velocity of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> changes from <math alttext="positive 2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> to <math alttext="positive 5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. During a <math alttext="2 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> interval, the velocity of Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> changes from <math alttext="negative 1 meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mpadded><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> to <math alttext="positive 3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. What is the ratio of the average acceleration of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to the average acceleration of Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> during these intervals?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
